title: Disappearance Day of Sri Murari Gupta | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | ISKCON Bangalore Sanga
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Today is the disappearance day anniversary of Shri Murari Gupta, who was an intimate
associate of Shri Chaitanya Mahaprabhu.
Let us hear about his wonderful devotional qualities from Shri Chaitanya Charitamrita.
Murari Gupta was a storehouse of love of Godhead.
His great humility and meekness melted the heart of Lord Chaitanya.
Shri Murari Gupta wrote a book called Shri Chaitanya Charita.
He belonged to a Vaidya physician family of Shri Hatha, the paternal home of Lord Chaitanya
and later became a resident of Navadvipa.
He was among the elders of Shri Chaitanya Mahaprabhu.
Shri Murari Gupta never accepted charity from friends nor did he accept money from anyone.
He practiced as a physician and maintained his family.
With his earnings, as Murari Gupta treated his patients, by his mercy, both their bodily
and spiritual diseases subsided.
Once Sivananda Sena offered food to Lord Chaitanya that had been cooked with excessive ghee.
And the next day, Lord Chaitanya became sick and went to Murari Gupta for treatment.
Lord Chaitanya accepted some water from the water pot of Murari Gupta.
And thus, he was cured.
The natural remedy for indigestion is to drink a little water.
And since Murari Gupta was a physician, he gave the Lord some drinking water and cured
him.
When Chaitanya Mahaprabhu appeared in the house of Srivastakur in his Chaturbhuja murti,
Murari Gupta became his carrier in the form of Garuda and in these pastimes of ecstasy,
the Lord then got up on his feet.

and passed down the back of Murari Gupta.
When Sri Chaitanya Mahaprabhu one day appeared in ecstasy as the Varaha Murti,
Murari Gupta offered him nice prayers.
Murari Gupta gave Zuvar posso kepada Sat-Siat Rao one time.
Once Lord Chaitanya Mahaprabhu glorified Murari Gupta for his unf constellating devotion and loyalty

Once Lord Chaitanya Mahaprabhu glorified Murari Gupta for his unf constellating devotion and loyalty to Lord Rama Chandra because
Mahaprakasha form, Lord Chaitanya appeared before Murari Gupta as Lord
Ramachandra. Just to test Murari's faith, he repeatedly encouraged Murari Gupta to
shift his worship from Lord Rama to Lord Krishna, describing the unparalleled
sweetness, supremacy and all attractive nature of Shri Krishna, who is the origin
of all incarnations and the reservoir of all transcendental qualities and
pleasure. Although Murari heard these divine glories of Krishna from the Lord
himself, his heart remained steadfastly fixed on his eternal master Lord
Ramachandra. Murari being utterly devoted could not imagine giving up the
service of Lord Rama's lotus feet.
That night he was deeply troubled, weeping continuously and praying that
death might take him before he was forced to abandon his worship of Lord
Ramachandra. He spent the entire night awake, overwhelmed by distress. The next
morning Murari approached Lord Chaitanya, fell at his feet and humbly confessed
that though he desired to please the Lord,
he could not forsake Lord Ramachandra for he had sold his head and heart to
Lord Rama's service. Torn between obedience to Chaitanya's command and loyalty to
Lord Ramachandra Murari begged for death as his only release. Hearing this
pure devotion Shri Chaitanya Mahaprabhu became overjoyed. Embracing Murari Gupta,
Lord Chaitanya praised his
unwavering faith declaring that such steadfast devotion is a true hallmark of
a servant. The Lord revealed that his repeated persuasion was merely a test to
demonstrate Murari's deep unbreakable attachment to Lord Ramachandra.
Recognizing him as an incarnation of Hanuman, the eternal servant of Rama,
Mahaprabhu accepted Murari Gupta as his very life and soul moved by his
humility and unalloyed devotion. It is a desire of Murari Gupta to leave his body
before the disappearance of Sri Chaitanya Mahaprabhu but the Lord forbade
him to do so.
